info.name: Septal nuclei
info.description: The septal nuclei constitute the septal area or region. This is a small area just rostral to the anterior commissure and in the medial wall of the cerebral hemisphere. These nuclei extend up into the septum pellucidum. As part of the limbic sytem, they have reciprocal connections with the hippocampus via the fornix, the amygdala via the stria terminalis, etc.
